news.title: A court blocked a migrant being returned to France - how much of a setback is this for No 10?
news.summary: The temporary decision by a High Court judge shows how complicated deportation or removal plans can be.

news.title: Thousands of Palestinians flee as Israeli troops push into Gaza City
news.summary: Israel says its aim is to defeat up to 3,000 Hamas fighters who remain there, but the offensive has drawn international condemnation.

news.title: Scotland's not proven verdict to be scrapped as MSPs back reforms
news.summary: The verdict has been used in criminal trials for hundreds of years but campaigners had called for it to be abolished.

news.title: Obama says US faces 'political crisis' after killing of Charlie Kirk
news.summary: The former president criticised the response to the shooting by President Trump, who has vowed to tackle "radical leftists".

news.title: Tests show Navalny was poisoned in jail, his widow says
news.summary: Yulia Navalnaya is urging the two laboratories she says found her husband was poisoned to release their findings.

news.title: AI can forecast your future health – just like the weather
news.summary: An artificial intelligence model can predict the risk of more than 1,000 diseases, a team of scientists say.

news.title: Jaguar Land Rover supply chain staff told to apply for universal credit, union claims
news.summary: Staff are being laid off with "reduced or zero pay" following a cyber attack, which has forced the carmaker to shut down, Unite union claims.

news.title: Melania’s hat, Kate’s feather brooch and other standout looks so far
news.summary: State visits are often seen as an opportunity to exercise “sartorial diplomacy” on the world stage.

news.title: Thousands gather in London to protest against visit
news.summary: A coalition of more than 50 groups have organised a march in central London against the visit.

news.title: What is the President's schedule while he's in the UK?
news.summary: US President Donald Trump and his wife Melania are in the UK for an unprecedented second state visit.
